EN

Bitcoin has crashed below $66,000 to just over $65,000, effectively wiping out all gains recorded since Donald Trump‚Äôs reelection and losing nearly 50% of its value from its October 2025 all-time high. Analysts from The Kobeissi Letter attribute this sharp decline to "emotional" selling driven by negative investor sentiment rather than any fundamental issues within the Bitcoin ecosystem. Regarding market outlook, analysts are identifying potential entry points amid the volatility. Analyst Doctor Profit has placed large buy orders in the $57,000 to $60,000 range, anticipating this level to be the bottom for a short-term hold. Meanwhile, MMCrypto suggests the bear market is in its final stages of capitulation, implying that the "max pain" point is approaching before a potential recovery.

Key Points

  • BTC plummeted to $65K, erasing post-election gains and losing nearly 50% since its October 2025 ATH.
  • Analysts cite "emotional" selling as the primary driver, not fundamental ecosystem issues.
  • Doctor Profit predicts a bottom between $57K-$60K, while MMCrypto believes the bear market is in its final capitulation phase.
  • XRP is the worst-performing altcoin, dropping nearly 20% in 24 hours.

Article

Meanwhile, XRP continues to be the poorest performing altcoin today. Bitcoin has officially wiped out all gains registered after the reelection of Donald Trump to step back in the White House at the end of 2024. The cryptocurrency plummeted to just over $65,000 minutes ago, which actually puts it in a minor loss since the presidential elections. Moreover, this means that it has lost almost $25,000 since last Wednesday. It has also shed nearly 50% of its value since the all-time high marked in early October 2025. Naturally, investors tend to ask themselves what the most probable reason is behind this crash. As with all previous declines from the past several weeks, it doesn‚Äôt seem to be aligned with problematic fundamentals within the BTC ecosystem as a whole. Analysts from the Kobeissi Letter indicated that the actual reason behind the consecutive price dumps is ‚Äúemotional‚Äù selling. Riskier assets, such as BTC, tend to move frequently due to investor sentiment, and the current bearish trend appears to be driven by a mass exodus without any fundamental basis. BREAKING: Bitcoin falls below $66,000 for the first time since October 2024, now down -$11,000 this week alone. The analyst added that they plan to hold for 2-3 months, and they are not interested in buying higher than that.
